entries.meaning: (zoology, uncountable) The condition or character of being covered with scales.
examples: A Palæoniscoid fish showing a condition of squamation almost identical with that of Polyodon.

entries.meaning: (zoology, countable) A particular arrangement of scales; a special mode or form of squamation.
examples: A fish from the Muschelkalk…has been made the type of the genus Prohalecites on account of peculiar features in its squamation.

entries.meaning: (pathology, dermatology, countable) A scaly growth on the skin.
